p: The ethanolic extract obtained from the rhizome residue of Cyperus articulatus from Santar√©m, Brazil, contained corymbolone as the main compound identified and exhibited a moderate level of activity against two strains of Plasmodium falciparum (W2 and 3D7). The EECA also showed low cytotoxicity against the human cell line WI-26-VA-4. Our results demonstrate the therapeutic potential of C. articulatus as an antiplasmodial agent.
